attributes.action: Require Coroners to record when a death resulted from using a prescription drug
attributes.additional_details: Coroners routinely list the cause of death as “alcohol/drug related”. We want the Government to require Coroners to record details of prescription drugs people were taking at the time of their death and when prescribed medications played a part in a death. This would allow for accurate public records and statistics as well raising more awareness for safer prescribing practices.
attributes.background: Coroners are not currently required to collect details of prescription drugs people were taking at the time of their death or record deaths from prescription drugs.
